author: Special Correspondent
text:
Six unauthorised dyeing units functioning in Pallipalayam and surrounding areas have been sealed on Tuesday. The units were discharging untreated effluents into River Cauvery flowing across Pallipalayam town.

District Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy had already issued a stern warning to the dyeing units against discharging untreated effluents into the river.

The Collector directed the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board and Revenue officials to conduct surprise check of the dyeing units and seal all those units that were indulging in activities violating pollution control board norms.

A team of officials led by M. Selvakumar, Assistant Executive Engineer, Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board and Mahatma, Revenue Divisional Officer, Tiruchengode, conducted surprise check in the dyeing units at Samayasangili and Thillainagar areas near Pallipalayam and spotted six units functioning without permission.

Mr. Dakshinamoorthy warned that similar surprise checks would continue.
title: Unauthorised dyeing units sealed
